reviewText: I bought this when I first got my Blu-ray player. I didn't want to invest good money in background disks that didn't look good so I used this as a "test". This DVD is just what it says it is -- a "sampler" of the company's products. Granted, it probably should be given away as a promo, but it's actually very nice and keep me satisfied for months before I succumbed to temptation and bought the FULL version of ALL of them (great sale at the company website).
summary: A great intro to the HDscape line of Blu-ray disks

reviewText: like some of the other titles in this series, the quality is excellent.  It really takes advantage of the high definition format.  However, this is like other titles in the series, the editing is very fast.  Too fast.  Not serene enough and just when you get to admire the moment of the scene, it changes.

reviewText: While this is a "Sampler" for other videos its still a retail item for sale itself.  With that being said, I was very disappointed that each scene starts with a banner or advertisement for the scene you are watching.  I was expecting something that could sit and cycle through on my TV but I really don't like the screens that show you what each scene you are already watching is.The sound is another problem I have.  Music is subjective.  Even if we agree on how serene an ocean view is, we aren't going to agree on what we should be listening to while viewing it.  For this I have to turn the sound down.  For this to be a center piece you need to be able to talk over it.  I would have much preferred more white noises like the actual ocean sounds, waves, wind, aquarium sounds, fire crackling, etc.There isn't a delicate way to put this, but at least one of the videos is of people.  While it fits in a sampler, I don't intend to watch other people as a screen saver on my TV.  My wife and I joke all the time... some people weren't made for high def (ourselves included).  While that may sound cruel, I truly wonder the target audience for that scene.  It wasn't poorly done, it just doesn't seem to fit with the other scenes and with what tends to sell in this genre.The images are of very good quality.  I particularly like the ocean life closeups.  They really brought out the power of HD.  I'd likely rate this closer to a 2 since it wasn't what I wanted and likely won't use it without heavy editing, but the quality is good enough on the actual videos that I give it a 3 as many people won't be as picky on the areas that I find intrusive.  I guess what makes me so picky is its price point.  As a sampler It was priced a little high in my opinion.
summary: Pretty images but not what I wanted

reviewText: This is a sampler of individual movies you can buy I believe.  For the reviewer that commented on the panning fireplace video, the actual Blu-ray disk has four different fires, one continual, one from match lighting to dying embers, a smaller romantic fire and, lastly, the one that appears to be sampled here where the view pans and zooms giving you the "best angles and shots".Fireplace: Visions of Tranquility [Blu-ray]

reviewText: Ever wonder what it takes to scratch a Blu-Ray Disc? That's what this disc is best used as. The HD Sampler Scratch Test Blu-Ray Disc.For the low low price of $7 you can find out what it takes to scratch a Blu-Ray Disc to the point of it being unplayable.Good Luck
summary: It has other uses than playing HD samples.

reviewText: This sampler is only good in that you will instantly realize there's no point in buying the full versions of the HDscapes.I've become a bit obsessed with trying to find the right "screensaver" for my HD TV.  Fireplaces and Aquariums are my favorite, so naturally I jumped at this sampler to see if maybe HDScape would be able to offer what I need.  Unfortunately, they did not.  These images aren't even true HD and are poorly filmed.  I wouldn't have any of the samples playing during any occasion, as it'd make my expensive tv look cheap.  Stay away!
summary: At least now I don't have to buy the full versions...
Title: N/A

reviewText: I don't know what people are complaining about. This is a beautifully made and cheaply sold sampler of full nature videos and it does the job as intended. While very enjoyable on its own, this sampler provides a glimpse into their full-length, truly beautiful, high definition nature vistas, which will be appreciated by everyone who is not yet dull-at-heart from all the nonsense we are fed by the regular broadcasts and "action" movies.
Title: N/A
